metadata.title: CVE-2015-7762 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
rx/rx.c in OpenAFS before 1.6.15 and 1.7.x before 1.7.33 does not properlyinitialize the padding of a data structure when constructing an Rxacknowledgement (ACK) packet, which allows remote attackers to obtainsensitive information by (1) conducting a replay attack or (2) sniffing thenetwork.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7762` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent1 - 1.6.15-1
libafsrpc1 - 1.6.15-1
libkopenafs1 - 1.6.15-1
libpam-openafs-kaserver - 1.6.15-1
openafs-client - 1.6.15-1
openafs-dbserver - 1.6.15-1
openafs-fileserver - 1.6.15-1
openafs-fuse - 1.6.15-1
openafs-kpasswd - 1.6.15-1
openafs-krb5 - 1.6.15-1
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.6.15-1
openafs-modules-source - 1.6.15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.15-1').
